Dragon Ball Z was one of the best anime of its time and still arguably holds up today. However, it still suffers many major problems besides filler. Just cutting out filler and using remastered footage is incredibly lazy and should not qualify as a new adaptation. Also, some parts are censored even in the uncut versions that aren't subtle and don't make much sense visually. When Piccolo shoots a Special Beam Cannon into Goku's and Raditz's chest, the hole shown in both the manga and original anime is replaced by something completely different that I can't for the life of me make out what thehell it's supposed to be. When Krillin shot a ki blast through Vegeta, there was no hole to be seen. The soundtrack is repetitive and forgettable, using the same generic track at least once every episode no matter the scene or whether it fits or not. Although they made many stupid changes, they made a major improvement in terms of voice acting and dialogue, especially in the dub. However, the dub can't seem to choose whether it wants to use the Japanese names or use the translations. They keep Japanese names for attacks but still uses the dub names like Krillin as opposed to Kuririn. While it's good for people new to Dragon Ball Z, it fails to set itself apart and compete with the original adaptation and suffers because of it.

The only thing I liked about DBZ Kai was because it followed the manga more than DBZ. However, I was disappointed by the visuals because, when they mentioned a "DBZ remake", I though that the animation would be new. Instead, the animation was "remastered". Not as I expected. Also, I was really disapointed because the Majin Buu arc was never shown. It seems to me that Akira Toriyama gave us "remastered" version instead of a full remake because he probably wanted to make maximum profit without spending a f*ckload of money.

Dragon Ball Z is one of my favourite series, it has been since I was a kid. Growing up watching Goku, Gohan and Vegeta fight Cell and Majin Buu is still one of my most prominent memories (because they didn't show anything earlier on morning kids TV lol) and when I finally got around to watching DBZ when I was older, the 291 (I think) episode run which is rampant with pointless filler did make it harder to want to rewatch after the first time (and it took like a month), so I was so happy when I was Dragon Ball Kai. I really enjoyedit too, the fights were just the same and just as good, the redubbing made it closer to the original BUT I will say if you do plan on watching it, watch the uncut version.


STORY - 8

It's DBZ, it's story is always going to be a little weaker compared to some other shows and shounens. Kai is lucky in a sense since it's missing the worst of the sagas, the Buu/Fusion saga and the Android/Cell saga is still, in my opinion, the best. The filler being cut also makes each part run more smoothly, as we're not sent on "side quests" throughout an arc and the fights/action happens faster which is always better then dragging it out like the original did.


ART - 9

I've always loved the DBZ art style, it's pretty unique and I'm glad they just chose to remaster instead of re-do it. Don't really have any issues with the art.


SOUND - 9

They used the Japanese soundtracks this time which I prefer far more than the original soundtracks in the original Funimation dub (ALso, this is based on the dub, not sub). The original music in DBZ was kind of over the top for me, so this is a nice change. The VAs are at their best in this too and I saw some interviews saying they had more a clue this time round and it really shows. I also prefer the newer cast over the older cast, Gohan's voice to me in the original DBZ was grating and Freeza's new VA is honestly the best Freeza I've heard. The OP (English version) is also my favourite Dragon Ball opening ever too, so bonus points for that. 


CHARACTER - 10

This is biased honestly because I love DBZ so much to the point that I don't really hate any characters. DBZ is basically the Gohan and Vegeta show with Goku showing up to save the day, and since Vegeta is my favourite character I am perfectly okay with that. The dub always has made a habit of making Goku more of a hero than he is originally and I think that still sticks with Kai, so there's that. Since the filler was cu so were a lot of the annoying filler characters so that makes it more enjoyable in my mind too. 


ENJOYMENT - 10

It's DBZ, what can I say. I love the show so obviously I enjoyed it. As I mentioned, having the filler cut out made it so much more enjoyable to watch because the action happened so much faster. I've watched Kai countless times now, especially the Android/Cell Saga as it's my favourite and it doesn't take like a week to watch now.



OVERALL - 10

Honestly, this is an incredibly biased review as I've said. I love DBZ and Kai made it possible to watch the best bits without all the filler in between. It also made it much easier to watch and the 97 episode run is a lot more appealing than 291. If I were to recommend DBZ to anyone, of course I'd tell them to watch the original if they had the time, but Kai tells the main story points and kept the feeling of DBZ to me, so I would always say to watch Kai.
